First time poster, long time forum browser. First off, thanks to the community for the insight gained here at the forums. Please excuse grammatical errors, I'm posting mobile.

Problem #1: action groups not working on all symmetry placed parts. This is a random occurrence, usually only the part that was selected operates and it takes a revert to get it working, but most likely another group starts acting up. Anyone had similar issues?

Problem #2: very unusual spinning while landing on minimus. Rcs was able to bring it under control, but them started to spin the craft the k opposite direction. Had to revert, and ended the science day for me. This was an odd craft with two identical landers mounted radially. Would it be the extra probe cores or reaction wheels causing this? The problem only occurred once under about 3k altitude on minimus.

Issue #3: will connecting a module to a base via the claw with a docking port on the module satisfy a docking port requirement?

Advance thanks for any answers.

ALl I can tell you is my experience with #1 - I've only seen this happen when I change a part's placement and/or symmetry AFTER making the action group - it applies itself to one (EG) solar panel (the one I clicked on ro re-place) but not the others.

For problem 2, this could be because of your reference calibration. Try hitting Alt+X with SAS off, and on.

For problem 3, although the crafts will be considered docked by the module state, I believe it is dependent on the parts themselves. [scans the savestate for docking ports]

> 
> First time poster, long time forum browser. First off, thanks to the community for the insight gained here at the forums. Please excuse grammatical errors, I'm posting mobile.

Welcome aboard!

> 
> Problem #1: action groups not working on all symmetry placed parts. This is a random occurrence, usually only the part that was selected operates and it takes a revert to get it working, but most likely another group starts acting up. Anyone had similar issues?

Yeah, this is a known annoyance. If you ever move symmetrical parts after you've set an action group for them, it hoses the action group. To fix this, go to the action group menu and remove all the actions for that group, then put them back in.

> 
> Problem #2: very unusual spinning while landing on minimus. Rcs was able to bring it under control, but them started to spin the craft the k opposite direction. Had to revert, and ended the science day for me. This was an odd craft with two identical landers mounted radially. Would it be the extra probe cores or reaction wheels causing this? The problem only occurred once under about 3k altitude on minimus.

Probably control shifted to one of the radial landers. This is a frequent annoyance as well. To fix this, right-click on a centrally mounted pod or probe core and select "control from here". If that doesn't work, then it's some other problem I'm unaware of.

> 
> Issue #3: will connecting a module to a base via the claw with a docking port on the module satisfy a docking port requirement?

Dunno. Worth trying but don't be surprised if it doesn't satisfy the contract.

> 
> Problem #1: action groups not working on all symmetry placed parts. This is a random occurrence, usually only the part that was selected operates and it takes a revert to get it working, but most likely another group starts acting up. Anyone had similar issues?

From memory, that's actually intended behaviour - you set action groups for a part and then if you move the part, you must also update the action groups for it. It's stupid and very weird, but it's working as intended. If you're not against modding, Claw's StockBugFixModules includes a fix for this.

Thanks for the help. I'll keep that in mind for the action groups. Unfortunately my miner is already producing so I won't be reverting. I disabled the reaction wheels on the landers and everything went smoothly. These landers were adding the docking port and it f did fulfill the base contract. Now I need to figure out a landing platform for my refueling ship. I was thinking a low square pad with a docking port. Land above it and raise the gear to dock. Any suggestions on that aspect?
